greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array D(n,k) counting disconnected k-regular simple graphs on n vertices with girth exactly 3.
link: Jason Kimberley, Table of i, a(i)=D(n,k) for i = 2..145 (n = 2..24)
Jason Kimberley, Index of sequences counting disconnected k-regular simple graphs with girth exactly g
formula: D(n,k) = A068933(n,k) - A185204(n,k) [the former is padded to be a tabl but the latter is a tabf].
D(n,k) = A185643(n,k) - A186733(n,k) [both are tabl but the result is tabf].
xref: The sum of the n-th row is A210713(n).
Disconnected k-regular simple graphs with girth exactly 3: A210713 (any k), this sequence (triangle); for a fixed k: A185033 (k=3), A185043 (k=4), A185053 (k=5), A185063 (k=6).
results.author: _Jason Kimberley_, Jan 21 2013
